intro: Nemophila sepulta, commonly known as the Sierra violet, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are low-growing and branching. Nemophila sepulta plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
